method.name: GET
method.id: Retrieve a single API Access Control Resource Server.
method.doc: To retrieve a single API Access Control Resource Server with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP GET command on the API Access Control resource server URI.
Note that prior to running this web service the Verify Identity Access administrator credential must be stored using the Store the Verify Identity Access administrator credentials web service.
Note that if the resource server junction type is virtual host then the server_type=vhj query string parameter must be set.

param.doc: The number of threads which are allocated to service requests.

param.name: basic_auth_mode
param.doc: How the Reverse Proxy server passes client identity information in HTTP basic authentication (BA) headers to the back-end server.

param.name: cookie_include_path
param.doc: Specifies whether script generated server-relative URLs are included in cookies for junction identification.

param.name: insert_session_cookies
param.doc: Whether to send the session cookie to the junctioned Web server.

param.doc: The hard limit percentage for consumption of worker threads.

param.doc: The soft limit percentage for consumption of worker threads.

param.doc: Available HTTP identity headers

param.doc: Authorization rule decision information

param.doc: Whether to enforce mutual authentication between a front-end Reverse Proxy server and a back-end Reverse Proxy server over SSL.

param.name: preserve_cookie
param.doc: Specifies whether modifications of the names of non-domain cookies are to be made.

param.name: remote_http_header
param.doc: Inserted Verify Identity Access specific client identity information in HTTP headers across the junction.

param.name: request_encoding
param.doc: The encoding to use when the system generates HTTP headers for junctions.

param.name: servers
param.doc: Back-end servers for the junction. This is an encoded string and not a JSON object. Each server is separated by the '#' character. Each server contains a series of key value pairs separated by the ';' character. Each key value pair is in the format '<key>!<value>'.

param.name: stateful_junction
param.doc: Whether the junction supports stateful applications.

param.name: http2_junction
param.doc: Whether the junction supports the HTTP/2 protocol.

param.name: http2_proxy
param.doc: Whether the junction proxy supports the HTTP/2 protocol.

param.doc: The server name indicator (SNI) to send to TLS junction servers.

param.name: tfim_sso
param.doc: Is Federated Identity Manager single sign-on (SSO) enabled for the junction.

param.name: transparent_path_junction
param.doc: Whether a transparent path junction was created.

param.name: delegation_support
param.doc: This option is valid only with junctions that were created with the type of ssl or sslproxy. Indicates single sign-on from a front-end WebSEAL server to a back-end WebSEAL server.

param.name: scripting_support
param.doc: Supplies junction identification in a cookie to handle script-generated server-relative URLs.

param.name: forms_based_sso
param.doc: The name of the configuration file that is used for forms based single sign-on.

param.name: client_ip_http
param.doc: Specifies whether to insert the IP address of the incoming request into an HTTP header for transmission to the junctioned Web server. Value is "yes" or "no".

param.name: enable_basic_auth
param.doc: Specifies whether to use BA header information to authenticate to back-end server. Valid value is "yes" or "no".

param.name: ba_username
param.doc: The Reverse Proxy user name. Used to send BA header information to the back-end server.

param.name: version_two_cookies
param.doc: Either receiving this value or 'insert_ltpa_cookies'

param.doc: Either receiving this value or 'version_two_cookies'

param.doc: Whether to send the session cookie to the junctioned Web server.

param.name: key_label
param.doc: The key label for the client-side certificate that is used when the system authenticates to the junctioned Web server.

param.name: authz_rules
param.doc: Specifies whether to allow denied requests and failure reason information from authorization rules to be sent in the Boolean Rule header (AM_AZN_FAILURE) across the junction. Valid value is "yes" or "no".

param.name: virtual_junction_hostname
param.doc: If the junction is virtual

param.name: fsso_config_file
param.doc: The name of the configuration file that is used for forms based single sign-on.

param.name: junction_cookie_javascript_block
param.doc: Controls the junction cookie JavaScript block. The value should be one of: trailer, inhead, onfocus, xhtml10. Use trailer to append the junction cookie JavaScript to HTML page returned from back-end server. Use inhead to insert the JavaScript block between tags for HTML 4.01 compliance. Use onfocus to use the onfocus event handler in the JavaScript to ensure the correct junction cookie is used in a multiple-junction/multiple-browser-window scenario. Use xhtml10 to insert a JavaScript block that is HTML 4.01 and XHTML 1.0 compliant.

param.name: ltpa_keyfile
param.doc: Location of the key file that is used to encrypt the LTPA cookie data.

param.name: ltpa_keyfile_password
param.doc: An obfuscated version of the password for the LTPA key file (always '******').

param.name: server_sms
param.doc: Only applicable for virtual junctions. Specifies the replica set that sessions on the virtual junction are managed under. The replica set also provides the ability to group or separate log in sessions among multiple virtual hosts. If this option is not used to specify the replica set, the virtual host junction is automatically assigned to a replica set matching its virtual host name. For example, if the virtual host name is vhostA.example.com, the replica set is named vhostA.example.com. The replica set used for the virtual host junction must be present in the [replica-sets] stanza of the Reverse Proxy configuration file. This option cannot be used in a non-DSC environment.

param.name: server_vhost
param.doc: Only applicable for virtual junctions. Causes a second virtual junction to share the protected object space with the initial virtual junction. This option is appropriate for junction pairs only (2 junctions with complementary protocols). The option does not support the association of more than 2 junctions.

param.doc: Can this server be contacted by the Reverse Proxy?

param.name: operation_state
param.doc: Is this server being used to fulfill requests? Valid values are "Online" and "Offline". Administrators can set a particular server's operation state using pdadmin.

param.doc: The DNS host name or IP address of the target back-end server.

param.name: server_port
param.doc: TCP port of the back-end third-party server. Default is 80 for TCP junctions and 443 for SSL junctions.

param.name: http_port
param.doc: HTTP port of the back-end third-party server. Applicable when the junction type is tcp.

param.name: virtual_junction_hostname
param.doc: Virtual host name that is used for the junctioned Web server.

param.name: server_dn
param.doc: Specifies the distinguished name of the junctioned Web server.

param.name: server_cn
param.doc: Specifies the common name, or subject alternative name, of the junctioned Web server.

param.name: local_ip
param.doc: Specifies the local IP address that the Reverse Proxy is using when it communicates with the target back-end server.

param.name: query_content_url
param.doc: URL to the query contents resource which will allow the Reverse Proxy to populate the object space.

param.name: query_contents
param.doc: Current state of the query contents operation. Possible values are "working", "not working", "not found" and "unknown".

param.name: case_insensitive_url
param.doc: Specifies whether the Reverse Proxy server treats URLs as case sensitive. Valid values are "yes" or "no".

param.name: windows_style_url
param.doc: Specifies whether Windows style URLs are supported. Valid values are "yes" or "no".

param.name: current_requests
param.doc: The number of worker threads currently actively using this server.

param.name: total_requests
param.doc: The total number of requests fulfilled by this server.

param.name: transport
param.doc: The transport type. The valid values are none, http, https or both.

param.name: endpoint
param.doc: This is the introspection endpoint which will be called to handle the token introspection.

param.name: proxy
param.doc: The proxy, if any, used to reach the introspection endpoint.

param.name: auth_method
param.doc: The method for passing the authentication data to the introspection endpoint. Valid values are client_secret_basic or client_secret_post.

param.name: client_id
param.doc: The client identifier which is used for authentication with the external OAuth introspection endpoint.

param.name: client_id_hdr
param.doc: The name of the HTTP header which contains the client identifier which is used to authenticate to the introspection endpoint. Only valid if client_id has not been set.

param.name: token_type_hint
param.doc: A hint about the type of the token submitted for introspection.

param.name: mapped_id
param.doc: A formatted string which is used to construct the Verify Identity Access principal name from elements of the introspection response. Claims can be added to the identity string, surrounded by '{}'.

param.name: external_user
param.doc: A boolean which is used to indicate whether the mapped identity should correspond to a known Verify Identity Access identity or not.

param.name: response_attributes
param.doc: A list of rules indicating which parts of the json response should be added to the credential.

param.name: type
param.doc: The type of claim to add to the JWT. Valid values are either "text" for a literal text claim or "attr" for a credential attribute claim.

param.name: value
param.doc: The value for the claim. If the type is "text" this will be the literal text that is added to the JWT. If the type is "attr" this will be the name of the credential attribute to add to the JWT. Credential attribute claims may include the wildcard characters "*" or "?" to map multiple attributes. Eg: AZN_CRED_*

param.name: claim_name
param.doc: The name of the claim that is added to the JWT. For attr type claims this is optional and if not specified the claim name will be set as the name of the credential attribute. If the type is attr and the value contains a wildcard this field is invalid and if specified will result in an error.

param.name: pos
param.doc: The position of this attribute in the ordered list of all attributes.

param.name: action
param.doc: The action to perform for this attribute. Valid values are put and remove. Put will add the attribute to the response while remove will remote it from the response.

param.name: attribute
param.doc: The name of the attribute.
